description.narrative: Este proyecto se enfocará en un rango de amenazas que actualmente afectan o potencialmente podrían afectar la biodiversidad de la zona marino-costera de Venezuela, a través de la expansión y fortalecimiento del sistema de áreas protegidas

participating-org.narrative: MINIST. DEL AMBIENTE Y DE LOS

description.narrative: capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Enhanced institutional legal and policy framework developed to efficiently manage Marine and Coastal Protected Areas MCPA
Increase in METT scores related to management instruments categories 14 see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2

comment.narrative: The updated METT shows a result of 35112 which represents an increase in values of 48 from the base value calculated at the start of the project 26312 This increase is sustained on improvements in the technical training of staff and the inclusion of a greater number of technical staff related to some of the areas evaluated

The updated METT shows a result of 35112 which represents an increase in values of 48 from the base value calculated at the start of the project 26312 This increase is sustained on improvements in the technical training of staff and the inclusion of a greater number of technical staff related to some of the areas evaluated

description.narrative: Availability of geographical information to key decision makers

comment.narrative:
Only basic cartographic information is included in the Simón Bolívar Geoportal
Simón Bolívar Geoportal has recently been established and is not yet fully operational

75 layers of key information for PA management covering the project area are available on line of which 10 are continuously updated in real time
70 key institutional stakeholders Directorates of Ministries Universities and 18 PA managers in INPARQUES have downloaded and used key information in previous 3 months

It has been obtained an advance of 50 in the definition of the key information levels which will feature the Information System for Management Planning SIGOT for its acronyms in Spanish Similarly there is an index of information on Protected Areas with a total of 45 layers Also the cartographic information of each management instrument is being updated A total of 6 meetings with key stakeholders and institutions and 14 Protected Areas supervisors were conducted to define the type of information to update One out of the two visualization facilities is currently installed in a 100 The other facility shows a progress of around 20

description.narrative: PA managers have access to tools and instruments for the management the design and the declaration or expansion of PAs within the coastalmarine area
Total METT rating for PAs in relation to management tools and capacities criteria 523 see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2

comment.narrative: The updated METT shows a value of 210458 resulting in 5428 of progress towards the goal 387658 All management tools were taken into account improving the following indicators area management implementation management plans resource inventory and staff training

description.narrative: Total area of priority ABRAEs

comment.narrative:
Area 5662682 ha
Number 49

Corridor 5075051 ha 1
New PA 2060297 ha 4
PA Expansions 1719153 ha 11
Additional total 8854501 ha 5
Cumulative Total 14517183 ha 54

In the reporting period they have been addressed a total of 19 Protected Areas with a surface of approximately 120670949 ha This implies a rise of 1252 of the area established in the PRODOC Progress was also made in the drafting of a document that addresses general criteria for connectivity between Protected Areas in the coastal marine area
Regarding new Protected Areas the project addressed a total of 7 new areas covering an approximate surface of 160440 ha With regard to the expansion of existing Protected Areas the project addressed 3 areas with a total surface of 152525 ha The strategy has been to cover smaller surface areas and therefore more manageable seeking the representativeness of priority ecosystems added to the existing system
Given the fact that official publication of management instruments is outside the competence of the Ministry for Ecosocialism and Water it is highlighted recent changes in the approval processes of this type of management tools However the addressed instruments have covered the process of public and institutional consultation established by law

Corridor 5075051 ha 1

Regarding new Protected Areas the project addressed a total of 7 new areas covering an approximate surface of 160440 ha With regard to the expansion of existing Protected Areas the project addressed 3 areas with a total surface of 152525 ha The strategy has been to cover smaller surface areas and therefore more manageable seeking the representativeness of priority ecosystems added to the existing system
Given the fact that official publication of management instruments is outside the competence of the Ministry for Ecosocialism and Water it is highlighted recent changes in the approval processes of this type of management tools However the addressed instruments have covered the process of public and institutional consultation established by law

description.narrative: Government funding for PAs in the project area

comment.narrative: Estimated amount 15 million 22 of estimated needs to be confirmed during process of financial analysis at project startup
Estimated amount 2 million 30 above current level to be confirmed during process of financial analysis at project startup

Diagnostics were made for 7 Protected Areas referred to the different types of income As a result there are guidelines to develop specific mechanisms for planning and financial management capacity assessment of supervisors according to available funds and the proposed mechanisms for increasing diversification of revenues These diagnostics constitutes the base to formulate the financial plan for the Protected Areas System
Estimated amount 2 million 30 above current level to be confirmed during process of financial analysis at project startup

description.narrative: To promote intersector approaches to BD conservation through the tourism and fisheries sectors
Increase in the average total METT rating for protected areas in the project area

comment.narrative: 2731 out of a possible 9754
6410 out of a possible 8922

In the first quarter of 2015 a total of 12 meetings were held with administrators of Protected Areas for the induction of this methodology These meetings resulted in the definition of the strategy from the institutional point of view for filling the METT tool by Protected Areas managers
The results showed progress in the overall score and specific discussions showed the need for further efforts in terms of personnel management equipment infrastructure and detailed planning of areas and aspects related to budget and the financial management system
For the workshop with a duration of two days a total of 20 people were involved The updated METT shows as a result an increase in the total average of 719 points improving the base value by 538 The result of the current evaluation is 3459754 compared to the initial situation of 27319754
6410 out of a possible 8922

The results showed progress in the overall score and specific discussions showed the need for further efforts in terms of personnel management equipment infrastructure and detailed planning of areas and aspects related to budget and the financial management system
For the workshop with a duration of two days a total of 20 people were involved The updated METT shows as a result an increase in the total average of 719 points improving the base value by 538 The result of the current evaluation is 3459754 compared to the initial situation of 27319754

description.narrative: Improvements in the conservation status of Objects of Conservation OCs in the coastalmarine zone measured by proportions of OCs with different levels of conservation status as defined by PDVSA INTECMARUSBTNC study

comment.narrative:
Conservation status of OCs
Threatened 29
Moderate status 43
Very good status 28

Conservation status of OCs
Threatened 6
Moderate status 47
Very good status 47

The results obtained in Outcome 2 have helped to decrease the degree of threat of Protected Areas with the majority of Conservation Objectives OC This underpinned by the administrators of the areas who have updated management tools that allow them to optimize decisionmaking

description.narrative:
Aumento de la calificación METT en las áreas protegidas de influencia del proyecto
Número de instrumentos de gestión generados
Número de nuevas Áreas Protegidas Marino Costeras creadas
Porcentaje de avance en la concreción del Sistema de Monitoreo en tiempo real de las condiciones físicas y biológicas de las Áreas Protegidas Marino Costeras

comment.narrative: Los objetos de conservación de la zona costera y marina, se encuentran amenazados en un 29%, en un estado moderado en un 43% y en muy buen estado en un 28%.

Realización de la Evaluación Final al Proyecto (últimos resultados) Instalación y puesta en marcha del Sistema de Monitoreo en tiempo real de las condiciones físicas y biológicas de las Áreas Protegidas Marino Costeras

Fue culminada la Evaluación Final al Proyecto. Los trabajos de instalación de las casetas sufrieron retrasos a consecuencia de la supresión del Ministerio, pero fue culminada satisfactoriamente su instalación y puesta en marcha. Restan actividades propias de cofinanciamiento del Proyecto vinculadas a culminar las capacitaciones y el reporte fotográfico que está en elaboración por el Ministerio y la publicación oficial del folleto y lanzamiento del video de las nuevas áreas protegidas.
Realizar auditoria del Proyecto
Fue realizada la auditoria del Proyecto sin observaciones. El informe fue entregado a la CO en el mes de mayo 2019.
